basics.name: Nora E. De la Rosa Hernández
basics.label: Senior Customer Service Advisor
basics.summary: Customer service and finance professional with 16 years of experience in client relations, credit, and administrative management across multinational organizations. Skilled in analyzing customer needs, ensuring service quality, and driving process improvements. Recognized for expertise in documentation management, analytical reasoning, and cross-functional collaboration with finance, logistics, and sales teams. Proactive leader with strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills, committed to delivering measurable results and continuous improvement.

work.name: Klüber Lubricación Mexicana
work.summary: SAP SD Key User during system migration; trained in Germany and by external consultants, authored user manuals, and trained the Mexico team.
highlights: Led projects including EDI implementation and SAP FI–SD integration with finance teams in Portugal.
Managed re-invoicing, product returns, credit notes, and record keeping for internal control and audits.
Achieved a 20% reduction in re-invoicing (SD Module) through a Six Sigma White Belt project (2nd place in KLMEX improvement projects).
Monitored administrative issues impacting overdue collections and initiated corrective actions.
Supported distribution accounts in Central America, coordinating exports with freight forwarders.
Managed customer portals (SupplyOn, eBIZ, Taulia, Plexus) for order intake, delivery confirmations, and ASN entries.
Performed quoting, order entry, invoicing, deliveries, and maintained customer master data accuracy
Monitored stock levels, lead times, and shipments to ensure on-time deliveries.
Generated and analyzed KPIs and Orders on Hand reports for management.
work.technologies: SAP SD, SAP FI, EDI, SupplyOn, eBIZ, Taulia, Plexus, Six Sigma

work.name: Financiera Bepensa
work.summary: Managed automotive credit pipeline, partnerships, and financial analyses to drive placements.
highlights: Prospected and retained clients for automotive financing.
Built commercial relationships with dealerships to increase credit placements.
Performed financial and credit analyses for individuals and businesses.
Managed CRM pipelines, projections, and credit simulations.

work.name: Nissan - Shinyu Automotriz
work.summary: Directed financing and insurance operations, training, and negotiations to improve approvals and product penetration.
highlights: Achieved 90%+ approval rate for automotive credits.
Drove >40% penetration in financial products (warranties and insurance).
Trained and coached 20–25 sales advisors on credit processes.
Handled administrative procedures for insurance claims.
work.technologies: SIA, INTEGRA Systems, Insurance & Credit Management

work.name: Electricentro
work.position: Branch Manager / Inventory Control Project Lead
work.summary: Managed branch operations and led inventory control projects to optimize processes.

awards.title: Graduated with Honors
awards.summary: Honors distinction upon completion of Bachelor of Business Administration.
